Improved job prospects: With access to education, people would be better equipped to acquire the skills and knowledge needed to succeed in the job market. This would lead to improved job prospects and higher earning potential.

Reduced poverty: Education is a key factor in reducing poverty, as it helps people acquire the skills and knowledge needed to improve their economic prospects. If everyone had access to free, high-quality education, it would help reduce poverty rates.

Increased innovation: Education is a key driver of innovation, as it helps people develop the skills and knowledge needed to create new ideas and technologies. If everyone had access to free, high-quality education, it would lead to increased innovation.

Improved public health: Education is a key factor in improving public health, as it helps people understand the importance of healthy habits and how to prevent and treat illnesses. If everyone had access to free, high-quality education, it would lead to improved public health.

Increased political participation: Education is a key factor in political participation, as it helps people understand the political system and how to participate in it. If everyone had access to free, high-quality education, it would lead to increased political participation.
